content.description: This is probably the best trad line on Split Rock. It ascends the obvious, left-leaning crack/ramp facing the road. The crux is moving up and right from the end of the crack to the 2 bolt anchor. If anyone knows the name or FA info, please let me know.
content.protection: Cams and maybe a few nuts. 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: This ascends the obvious, left-leaning crack/ramp facing the road.

content.description: Climb the front left side of rock right of the black streak route (12a).
content.location: This is 2 routes to the right of the black streak route (12a).

content.description: Climb up the dihedral passing a bolt up high.
content.protection: Small gear and one bolt to anchors.

content.description:
Per

Erik in CO

: start with an easy (5.4-5.5) scramble up to a face. The face has one bolt and has about 4 moves of 5.8. A fall would not be nice from above bolt as you would hit a ledge.
content.protection: Bring quickdraws and gear.  To be edited in.

content.description:
This ascends the right side corner just outside West Chimney (just South of the "Split") on the North-facing side.

Face climb right of the crack. The 1st clip is an ankle buster if you blow it.
Work the left-trending crack to a face up to a single bolt. Go left, and exit up.
content.protection:
A standard rack, stoppers, and one bolt to coldshuts. It shares anchors with

5.8 South Slab

.
content.location:
On the South face of Split Rock, this ascends a left-facing dihedral right of

5.8 South Slab

.

content.description: An unremarkable jaunt with mediocre pro leads you to a fun move and a nice sequence up top.
content.protection: Small cams, stoppers, and 1 bolt to anchors.
content.location: This is on the South side of Split Rock. When you're taking the trail to Transmitter Tower, it is the face to your left and ascends the left side of the face.

content.description: This is short but fun. Climb a blocky crack to a seam with two bolts, angling slightly left and up to a two bolt anchor.
content.protection: A few mid size cams for the crack and two bolts.
content.location: It is just to the left of Good Nubbin on the south face.
